name: Dental studies
description: Within Health and Welfare / Health, Dental studies involve diagnosing, treating, and preventing diseases and abnormalities of the teeth and gums. It includes designing, making, and repairing dental prostheses and orthodontic appliances, as well as providing assistance to dentists. Public dental health is also covered.

name: Dental assisting
description: Providing support to dentists during dental procedures, managing patient records, and maintaining dental equipment, a role within Dental studies.

name: Dental hygiene
description: The practice of preventive oral health care, including cleaning teeth, examining patients for signs of oral diseases, and providing education on oral health, a key part of Dental studies.

name: Dental laboratory technology
description: The design, fabrication, and repair of dental prostheses such as dentures, crowns, and bridges, based on prescriptions from dentists, a specialization within Dental studies.

name: Dental nursing
description: Assisting dentists with patient care and clinical procedures, similar to dental assisting, within Dental studies.

name: Dental science
description: The scientific study of the oral cavity, teeth, gums, and related structures, as well as oral diseases and their treatment, the foundation of Dental studies.

name: Dental surgery
description: Surgical procedures performed on the teeth, gums, jaws, and other oral structures, a specialized area of Dental studies.

name: Dental technology
description: The application of technical skills and knowledge to create and repair dental appliances, synonymous with dental laboratory technology, within Dental studies.

name: Odontology
description: The scientific study of the structure, development, and abnormalities of the teeth, a core component of Dental studies.

name: Oral surgery
description: A branch of dentistry specializing in surgical treatments of the mouth, jaws, and facial structures, within Dental studies.

name: Orthodontics
description: The branch of dentistry concerned with the diagnosis, prevention, and correction of malpositioned teeth and jaws, a specialization in Dental studies.
